perturbation.original_text: MA shall make payment for all Technology according to the terms in Schedule A of this Agreement, and provide upon resale of any part of the Technology, two (2) signed copies of the Company License Agreement/Client Registration Card between Company and Client.
perturbation.changed_text: MA shall make payment for all Technology within 60 days of receiving the invoice, regardless of the terms in Schedule A of this Agreement, and provide upon resale of any part of the Technology, two (2) signed copies of the Company License Agreement/Client Registration Card between Company and Client.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction. The original text refers to payment terms outlined in Schedule A. The modified text introduces a fixed 60-day payment window, overriding any specific terms in Schedule A. This creates uncertainty about which payment deadline is enforceable, leading to disputes over contractual obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Services, training and support, when applicable and provided by Company, shall be paid for by MA according to agreed upon terms, and a monthly billing report will be created for MA by Company to show utilization of time and charges. A LATE PAYMENT CHARGE of one and one-half percent (1 ½%) or the maximum rate permitted by applicable law, whichever is less, of the outstanding balance due to Company per month will be imposed on all overdue accounts.
perturbation.changed_text: Services, training and support, when applicable and provided by Company, shall be paid for by MA according to agreed upon terms, and a monthly billing report will be created for MA by Company to show utilization of time and charges. No LATE PAYMENT CHARGE will be imposed on any overdue accounts.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a late payment charge of 1.5% per month. The modified text directly contradicts this by stating that no late payment charges will be applied. This introduces a clear inconsistency, making it unclear whether late payments will incur penalties, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may be terminated by either party at the expiration of its term or any renewal term upon thirty (30) days written notice to the other party. Company acknowledges that this Agreement shall not be terminated for MA’s failure to follow an operating plan, standard procedure, training manual, or substantial equivalent published in Paragraph 3 (k) of this Agreement, except that Company does reserve the right to terminate this Agreement for MA’s failure to follow required procedures relating to the processing of sales contracts, invoices and billing related to Technology sold under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be terminated by either party with no prior notice. Company acknowledges that this Agreement shall not be terminated for MA’s failure to follow an operating plan, standard procedure, training manual, or substantial equivalent published in Paragraph 3 (k) of this Agreement, except that Company does reserve the right to terminate this Agreement for MA’s failure to follow required procedures relating to the processing of sales contracts, invoices and billing related to Technology sold under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a 30-day written notice for termination. The modified text directly contradicts this by stating that termination can occur with no prior notice. This creates significant ambiguity regarding the termination process and requirements, potentially leading to disputes about the legitimacy of termination actions.
